column5: Great report, I enjoyed reading it - nice pics too.

Andrew as always a great report.Have you ever considered a career in writing or are you already doing that.  Nice to know I am not the only one to  use the lint from the dryer to start fires  Stren 30lb superbraid good line.3 sleeping bags wow talk about layers.    MTP
Great report as usual thanks for sharing WTG on the fish too they look great!!!!
I thoroughly enjoyed that report as much as all the other ones you post. Thank's for taking the time to do it, cheers  suds

WOW...i always look forward to reading your reports !!!!!! they are the best,  that was some incredible fishing the 2 of you did,and i love those scenery pics as well as the great colors of those walleyes.  ..sounds like a great fishing trip to go down all those rivers up there,in the great north...thanks for sharing...cheers
Another fine report from the Bunkster, that sure looks like fun. The leaves are still on the trees? Don't you normally contend with ice and snow by now?
Rain, rain, rain.... never ending rain Chris.  Snow....... sure hope no time soon but, if it meant less rain I might accept it's coming early.  Leaves are usually on this time of year.
great stuff, they need to put u and your reports on TV, that's a fishing show i would watch, u always make it feel like we were there with you
If I've said it once,,,I've said it twice Bud ! Stellar report, as always !
another awesome report it always amazing to see the golden color of the walleyes up in your area compared to northern quebec looking forward to the next report
Awesome report and pictures as usual Andrew.  Nice Ring on Bren's finger.  I see her angling it toward the camera now since the wedding  Joey
Moosebunk never fails to deliver; thanks for sharing a great story with us yet again.
ditto the comments above.  Great pics and great descriptions to go with it.  Long live the war canoe.
Thanks for the read, beauty time of the year for a little camping. You've inspired me......
Great report as always MB.  Good to see you and your new bride enjoying some quality time together.

I hope you're keeping a diary, Andrew. When I was a kid, MANY years ago, stories such as yours were what inspired me. I would stay up nights and pour over maps planning the next adventure. Now, fifty plus years later, I read reports such as yours and they still inspire me and send me back to the maps. You're living out a lot of my childhood dreams. Good on ya for sharing your adventures with us.

Yep, that was a great read bud, many thanks for taking the time. Interesting about the cranes...I saw a flock of about 100 feeding in a stubblefield just north of Ville Marie on the way home last Sunday. Obviously they do migrate together like geese, but I've never seen it before either.
Thanks Moose, reading your tales is always an excellent way to start my day.  What a wonderful life you live !!......but I spose you already know that
Good stuff bunk, always look forward to your posts! Thanks.
great report
Great report and pictures, thanks...
Thanks for sharing Andrew. Amazing part of our country you call home.
Fantastic outing!!!!
Very nice.  Your contributions to this board are always an excellent read.
Moose was that your  Honeymoon!!!!!!  Nice color on those eyes!!!!!!!!
thanks for sharing with us! Great report!

Wow...I got tired just reading your report....LOL.  I dont know how you do it...seriously!!  I get in our canoe for 3 hours and my back is killing and I'm exhausted and there are no portages, very little water that's too shallow for the trolling motor etc....  Amazing report as usual Moose....the story and pics allows me to imagine what you two experienced.  Very pretty scenery...almost as nice as the Shire...you'll have to come fish here sometime.  The fish are a little smaller, but we do ok down here....LOL.
Thanks for the little get-a-way.....great read!  dk

Another spectacular report! I thought the fishing up there was as easy as finding water, casting and catching but it sounds like you work hard for your fish. Sorry to hear the cheepas wasn't so cheap but over all it sounds like another great adventure in the great Canadian north!
As always, thanks for sharing your getaways with the rest of us. Great report!
great report
Would ya just look at the colour on those eyes?!  Your lady has the midas touch!  Ya got the gift of the gab Andrew, something we can all aspire to, myself especially.  SHWEETLY done bro.  cheers HD
